channel.title: Comments for page "Wander The Sands (Taijutsu 17d13s)"
channel.description: Posts in the discussion thread "Wander The Sands (Taijutsu 17d13s)"

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: SBYN theme, Diagnosis jutsu and Haus as ally in mission or at least one use of Power of Greass with 10-20 stam (u can find mission even with 10000 stam but burn them at kaiju or wkai or whateverelse and do not use ANY app/stam bonuses before this step if u planned finding Tobi at this day to have possibility for other things today :) sorry for spam, this were just for those who didn't think/know about this before:) ) and….. You got an Ally! Good Boy! :D Luck is much at bvs, BUT we still can increase our chances :)

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Based on who is character is REALLY based off of, He's probably throwing some crazy RNGHaet jutsu on us to constantly fail and fail and fail, just to make us savor the end result more. Bastards.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: End result: 500 allowed smokebombed missions, 1100 stamina and I got him on my last bit of stamina…sheesh

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: Its RNG hate. I'm trying to get Good Boy for his jutsu "I Need This - +1 Success, +100% Ally Drop find chance" which will help me for drop farming, yet I've smokebombed my way through hundreds of smoke bombs and haven't seen the mission yet.

item.title: (no title)
item.content:encoded: it's just crazy stamina RNG hate. you'll get used to it. since sometimes in monochrome you won't see a mission for days at a time. also try running standard 10 stamina missions and try to get a decent cloak to reduce the stamina penality. I've been lucky and tend to get Good Boy after 2-5 missions after Bones. recommended team i use: Bones, Haus, and an ally that modifies the stat you're looking at challenging.

item.title: Error? RNG Hate?
item.content:encoded: Is there some trick to this? Swear to God, I've dumped a few thousand stamina (with Bones, before you ask), without even seeing the mission, much less getting Good Boy. I've climbed plenty of mountains of gore, crossed through dozens of crumbling ruins, but no voices on the wind. Is this just some crazy RNG hate? Or something more sinister?
